meanings.definition: The quality or state of being slow or lacking energy.
meanings.sent1: Her sluggishness in the morning made her late for school.
meanings.sent2: The sluggishness of the turtle was evident as it moved slowly across the sand.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful sluggishness made it seem like it was moving in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: The sluggishness of the old computer was like trying to run a marathon in quicksand.
meanings.sent5: The heat of the day added to the sluggishness of the workers, making progress even slower.

meanings.definition: A lack of responsiveness or alertness.
meanings.sent1: His sluggishness in answering the phone annoyed his boss.
meanings.sent2: The sluggishness of the student in class indicated a need for more rest.
meanings.sent3: The dog's adorable sluggishness in catching the ball was due to its sleepy mood.
meanings.sent4: The sluggishness of the computer mouse made it difficult to navigate the screen quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sluggishness of the traffic lights caused frustration among the drivers waiting at the intersection.
